data.oai_dc:dc: occurence, antarctic krill, observation, Euphausia superba, Antarctic fish|Observation

359 Antarctic krill catches were analysed for by-catch, it took 48.5% of observed catches and 31.3% of total catches. Fish by-catches were usual in the sector 48.1 (89.1% of cases), the most of by-caught fishes belonged to families Nototheniidae (NOX) (66.3%). Fish by-catches in the sector 48.2 were recorded in 50% examined catches, the most frequent were fishes of families Myctophidae (LXX).|329 occurrences
